intro: Argostemma trichanthum, commonly known as the hairy argostemma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with five petals. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
